byline.contributor: Mujib Mashal reported from Kabul, and Taimoor Shah from Kandahar. Jawad Sukhanyar contributed reporting from Kabul, and Khaled Alokozay from Nangarhar.
byline.original: By MUJIB MASHAL and TAIMOOR SHAH

abstract: Residents in Lashkar Gah, capital of Helmand Province, Afghanistan, worry neighborhood will fall to Taliban camped in capital’s suburb of Babaji; fierce fighting by insurgents to gain Afghan province valued for its opium production and proximity to Pakistan causes deployment by NATO troops and American Special Forces to prevent area’s capture.
lead_paragraph: Lashkar Gah, the capital of Helmand Province where many Afghans have fled seeking safety, is under threat from insurgents.

headline.main: Last Refuge From Taliban for Afghans May Prove No Refuge at All
headline.print_headline: As Taliban Surge, Last Refuge for Afghans May Prove No Refuge at All

snippet: Lashkar Gah, the capital of Helmand Province where many Afghans have fled seeking safety, is under threat from insurgents.
